results.byline: By Jack Ewing and Neal E. Boudette
results.title: Tesla’s Sales Drop, a Sign That Its Grip on the E.V. Market Is Slipping
results.abstract: Sales of the company’s electric cars dropped in the first three months of the year, even as other automakers sold more battery-powered vehicles.

media.caption: Tesla’s relatively flat sales are the latest sign that the company’s dominance of the market for electric cars is slipping.

results.byline: By Christopher Flavelle and Ian C. Bates
results.title: Warming Is Getting Worse. So They Just Tested a Way to Deflect the Sun.
results.abstract: A trial in California is testing a machine designed to reflect sunlight back into space. “All my colleagues hope that we never use these things,” one researcher said.

media.caption: A spraying machine designed for cloud brightening on the flight deck of the Hornet, a decommissioned aircraft carrier that is now a museum in Alameda, Calif.

results.title: The Case Against ‘Good’ Coffee
results.abstract: Instant coffee tastes … just OK. And that’s fine by me.

results.title: You Can Bet on Caitlin Clark Making Threes. The N.C.A.A. Isn’t Happy.
results.abstract: Americans will wager $2.7 billion on the N.C.A.A. basketball tournaments this year, raising concerns about what happens to sports when people bet on the performances of student athletes.
